item.title: 澳大利亚债券吸引两年来最大的日本资金流入
item.description: 澳大利亚债券吸引了日本投资者两年多来最大规模的资金流入，因为较低的货币对冲成本提高了澳大利亚债券的吸引力。【原文：Australian bonds attracted the largest inflow from Japanese investors in more than two years as lower currency hedging costs boosted the attractiveness of the Antipodean bonds.】

item.title: 美国出人意料地威胁征收 25% 关税，为马来西亚汇率走势蒙上阴影
item.description: 美国出人意料地决定将其威胁对马来西亚征收的关税提高到 25%，这意味着贸易几乎肯定会成为这个东南亚国家周三利率决定的主要因素。【原文：The surprise US decision to raise its threatened tariff on Malaysia to 25% means trade will almost certainly dominate the Southeast Asian nation’s interest rate decision on Wednesday.】

item.title: 印度礼品城交易所将进行首次外币上市
item.description: 印度 NSE 国际交易所的目标是在本季度吸引首家外币股票上市，该交易所称这是一个里程碑，将为企业展示一个新的筹资渠道。【原文：India’s NSE International Exchange is aiming to attract its first equity listing in a foreign currency this quarter, a milestone it says will demonstrate a new fundraising avenue for firms.】

item.title: 深圳证券交易所敦促中国企业加快 IPO 申请速度
item.description: 中国深圳证券交易所敦促经纪商加快企业在创业板的上市申请，因为中国政府正努力促进民营企业发展，重振受到关税上涨威胁的经济。【原文：China’s Shenzhen Stock Exchange has urged brokers to speed up applications for companies to list on the ChiNext board as officials seek to boost private enterprise and reignite the economy under threat from rising tariffs.】

item.title: 日产 CDS 因 40 亿美元外国债券计划跃升至 16 年新高
item.description: 在日产汽车公司开始准备出售 40 亿美元的外币债券后，该公司的信用违约掉期扩大至 2009 年以来的最高水平，加剧了人们对利息支出上升的担忧。【原文：Nissan Motor Co.’s credit-default swaps widened to the highest level since 2009 after the automaker began preparing a $4 billion foreign-currency bond sale, stoking concerns about rising interest expenses.】

item.title: 印度卢比因关税担忧表现逊于大多数亚洲新兴货币
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 泰国有信心通过贸易提议降低美国关税
item.description: 泰国财政部长披差-春哈瓦吉拉（Pichai Chunhavajira）表示，根据美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）提出的将大部分美国商品的进口税降至零的提议，泰国仍对获得低于其宣布的 36% 的关税税率持乐观态度。【原文：Thailand remains optimistic about securing a lower tariff rate than the 36% levy announced by President Donald Trump based on an offer to bring down import tax on most US goods to zero, according to Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira.】

item.title: 马来西亚将继续就关税问题与美国接触：马来西亚贸易部
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁要对东南亚国家征收 25% 的关税（高于 4 月份宣布的 24%）之后，马来西亚将继续与美国接触，以达成一项 "互利 "的贸易协定。【原文：Malaysia will continue to engage with the US for a “mutually beneficial” trade agreement after President Donald Trump threatened to impose a 25% tariff on the Southeast Asian nation, higher than the 24% announced in April.】

item.title: 据说 Stonepeak 正在洽谈投资华平投资的普林斯顿大学
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，Stonepeak Partners 正在洽谈对数据中心运营商普林斯顿数字集团（Princeton Digital Group）的投资，这家美国基础设施投资商正寻求在亚太地区建立业务。【原文：Stonepeak Partners is in talks to invest in data center operator Princeton Digital Group, people familiar with the matter said, as the US infrastructure investor seeks to build up its presence in Asia Pacific.】

item.title: 即使夏季电力需求增加，中国仍避免进口昂贵的液化天然气
item.description: 闷热的气温提高了中国的用电需求，但还不足以重振中国对成本高昂的液化天然气的现货采购。【原文：Sweltering temperatures are pushing up appetite for electricity in China — just not yet enough to revive the country’s spot purchases of costly liquefied natural gas.】

item.title: 中国华友钴业利润受印尼影响创历史新高
item.description: 中国浙江华友钴业股份有限公司（Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt Co.浙江华友钴业股份有限公司预计将公布创纪录的半年度盈利报告，因为该公司正在加紧印尼的镍矿项目，并将享受钴价上涨带来的利好。【原文：China’s Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt Co. Ltd expects to report record half-year earnings, as it ramps up nickel projects in Indonesia and enjoys the tailwind from rising cobalt prices.】

item.title: 澳大利亚商业条件和信心在澳大利亚央行决议前大幅上升
item.description: 由于销售额、盈利能力和就业人数激增，澳大利亚的商业形势大为改观，同时信心也在攀升，这表明企业部门的复苏可能正在与储备银行的宽松周期保持一致。【原文：Australian business conditions jumped as sales, profitability and employment surged while confidence also climbed, suggesting a recovery in the corporate sector may be unfolding in line with the Reserve Bank’s easing cycle.】

item.title: 交易商评估特朗普关税声明，铁矿石大幅上涨
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在公布第一波威胁征收更高关税的信函后，表示愿意进行更多谈判，铁矿石因此出现波动。【原文：Iron ore fluctuated as US President Donald Trump signaled he was open to more negotiations after he unveiled his first wave of letters threatening to impose higher tariffs.】

item.title: 焦点转向谈判，新兴市场货币上涨
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在对十多个国家设定关税税率后不久表示愿意进行谈判，新兴市场货币收复了部分失地。【原文：Emerging market currencies recovered some of their losses after US President Donald Trump signaled he is open to negotiations shortly after setting tariff rates for more than a dozen countries.】

item.title: 截止日期推迟至 8 月 1 日，亚洲受困于特朗普的关税政策
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将关税截止日期推迟到 8 月 1 日，并将他为日本、韩国和其他国家设定的税率四舍五入，亚洲依赖出口的经济体获得了更多的时间，但几乎没有缓和的余地。【原文：Asia’s export-dependent economies received more time but little reprieve, as US President Donald Trump shifted his tariff deadline to Aug. 1 and rounded the rates he’s set for Japan, South Korea and others.】

item.title: 日本 6 月初出口在关税提高前略有增长
item.description: 由于美国政策继续影响贸易流动，在特朗普政府计划征收更高关税之前，日本的出口在 6 月份的前 20 天有所增长。【原文：Japan’s exports edged up in the first 20 days of June ahead of the Trump administration’s scheduled imposition of higher tariffs as US policy continues to impact trade flows.】

item.title: 澳大利亚资产管理公司 Platinum 和 L1 Capital 同意合并
item.description: 澳大利亚投资公司 Platinum Asset Management 和 L1 Capital 周二发表声明，同意合并。【原文：Australian investment firms Platinum Asset Management and L1 Capital have agreed to a merger, according to a statement Tuesday.】

item.title: 交易商关注美国关税和红海袭击事件，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 投资者将注意力转向美国征税的潜在影响和红海敌对行动的升级，石油市场因此趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied as investors turned their attention to the potential fallout from US levies and an escalation of hostilities in the Red Sea.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税要求抵消了美元走强的影响，黄金走势平稳
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）开始向一系列国家通报其最新关税税率，黄金在上一交易日扭转跌势后企稳，对美国主导的贸易战愈演愈烈的担忧支撑了避险需求。【原文：Gold steadied after reversing losses in the previous session when President Donald Trump began informing a suite of nations of their latest tariff rates, with concerns about a growing US-led trade war bolstering haven demand.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布新关税期限后，日韩股市上涨
item.description: 日本和韩国股市在周二早盘交易中上涨，原因是市场谨慎地希望两国能在唐纳德-特朗普新近延长的关税期限之前达成贸易协议。【原文：Japanese and South Korean equities rose in early Tuesday trading on cautious hopes that the countries can reach trade deals ahead of Donald Trump’s newly-extended tariff deadline.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚通胀率降至 4.82%，降幅超过预期
item.description: 哥伦比亚的通货膨胀率降至近四年来的最低水平，这可能会支持上个月投票赞成降息的央行少数派。【原文：Colombia’s inflation rate dropped to its lowest level in nearly four years, potentially bolstering the case of the central bank minority who voted for an interest rate cut last month.】

item.title: 软银支持的 Ola 在印度大举 IPO 一年后陷入危机模式
item.description: 三年前，当 Ola Electric Mobility Ltd. 的滑板车作为印度广阔的两轮车市场上经济实惠的新产品受到追捧时，联合创始人兼亿万富翁巴维什-阿加瓦尔（Bhavish Aggarwal）正在英国度过数周的假期。【原文：Three years ago, when Ola Electric Mobility Ltd.’s scooters were in high demand as an affordable new offering for India’s vast two-wheeler market, co-founder and billionaire Bhavish Aggarwal was spending weeks away in the UK.】

item.title: 印度降息后，基金经理押注银行和消费类股票
item.description: 资金经理们押注印度银行业和消费类股票今年会有更大的发展空间，因为它们将受益于中央银行为促进经济增长而采取的积极降息政策。【原文：Money managers are betting Indian banking and consumption stocks have further to run this year, benefiting from the central bank’s aggressive policy rate cuts to lift economic growth.】

item.title: 特朗普下令更严格执行清洁能源税收规则
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）呼吁制定新的规则，限制太阳能和风能项目获得税收优惠，他的 3.4 万亿美元预算法案已经削减了这些项目的税收优惠，旨在终止绿色能源激励措施。【原文：US President Donald Trump called for new rules that would restrict access to tax incentives for solar and wind projects that already had been pared back by his $3.4 trillion budget bill designed to end green energy incentives.】

item.title: 人工智能芯片延期后三星利润自 2023 年以来首次下滑
item.description: 在向英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）出售尖端人工智能内存的计划遭遇挫折后，三星电子（Samsung Electronics Co.【原文：Samsung Electronics Co.’s profit shrank more than expected after encountering hiccups in plans to sell cutting-edge AI memory to Nvidia Corp.】

item.title: 韩国承诺在特朗普规定的新期限后修订法规
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普致函亚洲盟友，要求在 8 月份的最后期限之前降低 25% 的税率之后，韩国表示将修订相关法规，以满足美国降低非关税壁垒的要求。【原文：South Korea said it will fix rules and regulations to address US demand to lower non-tariff barriers after President Donald Trump sent a letter to the Asian ally with a new August deadline to impose 25% rates.】

item.title: 加纳在审查后从国际货币基金组织获得 3.67 亿美元付款
item.description: 加纳通过了国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）对其 30 亿美元项目的第四次审查，并将从该组织再获得 3.67 亿美元的付款。【原文：Ghana will receive another $367 million disbursement from the International Monetary Fund after passing the fourth review of its $3 billion program with the Washington-based lender.】

item.title: 亚洲投资者严阵以待关税风波再起：市场综述
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布对包括日本和韩国在内的主要地区贸易伙伴提高关税后，亚洲股市周二再次面临压力。【原文：Asian stocks face renewed pressure Tuesday after President Donald Trump announced higher tariffs on key regional trading partners including Japan and South Korea.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉债券持有人寻求阻止黄金储备公司对 Citgo 的竞购
item.description: 委内瑞拉一些违约债券的持有者正在寻求阻止收购 Citgo 石油公司母公司的竞标，因为他们声称该交易将剥夺他们的受偿权。【原文：Holders of some defaulted Venezuelan bonds are seeking to block a bid to purchase Citgo Petroleum Corp.’s parent company, as they claim the transaction would strip them of their rights for payment.】

item.title: 日本加征 25% 关税，大选过后仍有寻求协议的余地
item.description: 日本首相石破茂称，美国宣布略微提高关税 "确实令人遗憾"，同时他发誓将在扩大的贸易谈判中继续保护日本的利益。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba called the announcement of slightly higher US tariffs “truly regrettable” while he vowed to continue to protect his nation’s interests in the extended trade negotiations.】
